An "YES" in this field will mean that entries will be raised for P/L for forward valued Trades for Own Book Portfolio. When this field is set as "YES", the fields CNT.REAL.PL.CAT.PR and CNT.REAL.PL.CAT.LO will become mandatory in SEC.ACC.MASTER.
Ex: If there is profit of $1000 on a Trade dated T + 3, the P/L entry will be raised only on Date - T + 3
An YES here will mean that
On Trade Date
An entry will be raised to the Contingent P/L bucket on Trade Date for $ 1000
On the Value Date
The entry to the Contingent P/L bucket will be reversed for $ 1,000 and the Profit will be posted to the original bucket.
A "NO" or a blank in this field will mean that NO contingent P/L entries will be posted until the Value Date of the Trade.

This is a YES/NO flag designed to allow the user to specify whether they want to consolidate all the foreign exchange positions on a SEC.TRADE and use these figures to enter exchange rates for the customer side of a SEC.TRADE transaction. If this is required the this flag should be set to YES. If the bank has a requirement to enter a rate for each customer into the CU.EX.RATE.REF field then this field should be set to NO.

If this field is set to YES the CU.EX.RATE.REF field on the SEC.TRADE application becomes a no-input field and the user has to enter a rate using the CONSOL.RATE field at the end of the transaction. The CONSOL.RATE field is a multi-valued field requiring a rate to be input for each currency that a customer is settling in that is not the Trade Currency of the SEC.TRADE transaction.

If this field is set to NO then the CONSOL.RATE is a no-input field and the fields TRADE.CURR to CON.VAL.DATE inclusive on the SEC.TRADE application are not used. In this case the CU.EX.RATE.REF field become mandatory.
Only inpuy of YES or NO allowed.

where REC.ID is STP id and Transaction id separated by '*'
